dcterms:creator: E. Troiano
C. Strapparava
G. Özbal
S. S. Tekiroğlu
dcterms:description: The HYPO dataset is an annotated collection of hyperbole consisting of manually composed hyperbole and hyperbole sourced from various online sources including click-bait headlines, love letters, advertisements, and animated cartoons. Annotation was carried out by crowd workers who assessed whether utterances contained hyperbolic content and highlighted specific words considered hyperbolic.
dcterms:title: HYPO

dcterms:creator: K. A. Whitehead
dcterms:description: Extreme Case Formulations (ECF) are semantic formulations that invoke extreme descriptions of events or objects. The dataset consists of test sentences designed to probe the ability of models to detect hyperbole.
dcterms:title: Extreme Case Formulations

dcterms:creator: L. Cano Mora
dcterms:description: Qualitative Hyperbole refers to hyperboles that align with the subjective-emotional dimension of hyperbole. The dataset consists of test sentences designed to assess the ability of models to detect qualitative hyperbole.
dcterms:title: Qualitative Hyperbole

dcterms:creator: L. Cano Mora
dcterms:description: Quantitative Hyperbole refers to hyperboles that align with the objective-gradational dimension of hyperbole. The dataset consists of test sentences designed to assess the ability of models to detect quantitative hyperbole.
dcterms:title: Quantitative Hyperbole
